results.title: Nine centuries of coal
results.creator_credit: J.B. Napier-Bell, Basic Films and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: The film tells the history of coal-mining from the 11th century until the present day. As digging developed, the hazards of flood, fire and poisonous fumes were added to an already dangerous occupation. The means to combat these dangers were only developed gradually. While following these technological developments, the film pays equal attention to the human factor, particularly during the period when women and children were employed in deep mines.

results.title: Nim and other oriented graph games
results.brief_description: Summary: Professor Gleason describes nim and related games and constructs an algebraic theory which gives information about games more complicated than nim

results.title: Niko: boy of Greece
results.brief_description: Filmed on the small Greek island of Mykonos. Deals with the daily life of a 10-year-old as he learns the crafts and traditions of the community. Shows fishing, sheep herding, baking, shopping and school activities. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Nightwork [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jane Schneider, Nicki Roller and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A gay primary school teacher discovers through her pupils that her lover may be cheating on her. She decides to take action by hiring a private detective to find the “other woman” and prove infidelity. Cast includes Gosia Dobrowolska and Shayne Foote.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Della Churchill and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A masked killer, a series of brutal murders, a confined space, a resourceful young hero and a terrifying confrontation. Nightride cleverly condenses the conventions of the horror film established in Halloween and Friday the 13th into a suspenseful 11 minute film.
results.description: A masked killer, a series of brutal murders, a confined space, a resourceful young hero and a terrifying confrontation. Nightride cleverly condenses the conventions of the horror film established in Halloween and Friday the 13th into a suspenseful 11 minute film.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Della Churchill and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A boy travelling on a night bus is witness to the murders of other passengers, by a masked killer. “Nightride” condenses the conventions of a horror film into 11 minutes, climaxing with a terrifying confrontation between the boy and the killer. This excellent Australian student short has won numerous international and national film festival awards.

results.title: Nightlife
results.brief_description: Robin Lehman explores the wonders of the cold seas of Ireland. Shows the many creatures and plants, including scallops, sea anemone, fan worm and jellyfish. This fantastic drama captures some of nature’s most amazing and improbable creations. Without words but accompanied by music and sound effects.

results.title: Night people's day
results.brief_description: Explores the city at night with emphasis on people who work at night and their occupations. The soundtrack recreates, with human voices and sound effects, the variety of sounds of the city and its activities. Night people tell why they prefer to work at night. Photography by Bob Hillman. Vocal sound effects by Bob Kurtz and Glenn Johnson.

results.title: Night on Bald Mountain = Nuit sur le Mont Chauve
results.brief_description: A significant early animation from the silent/sound transition period, this fantasy is based on Mussorgsky’s tone (symphonic) poem, evoking a world of demons, witches and goblins. The first film by the Parisian lithographer, Alexander Alexeieff (made with the assistance of his wife Claire Parker) using his famous pinboard invention which allowed production of a great range of tonal qualities.

results.title: Night flight
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Patterson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A rare insight into the life of the sugar glider, one of Australia’s unique nocturnal marsupials. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.
